Patch Set 3:

> Uploaded patch set 3.

This drops the README.md changes - I'll file another bug to cover the work to switch the CBE formally, which as well as testing and documenting the devzone upgrade procedure, also means backend hook work to ensure we can build rebuild releases using different jenkins jobs (to point at our current non-base-64 build machines)

For the record, the upgrade procedure bug is OS-7785. The status of that is that the mo hook changes changes are ready to integrate,
but we won't do that until this change has gone back.

Updated instructions for upgrading devzones across the multiarch->64
boundary are in https://cr.joyent.us/6363, but again should wait for
OS-7775 to integrate.

Change has been successfully merged by Tim Foster

Patch Set 7:

"make check" passed ok
Fine by me if we're going to move to a new requirement now if everyone else is OK with it??

OS-7535 said: "Currently, platform builds are only supported on multiarch – but there are packages that aren't supported in multiarch that we wish to be able to (ultimately) depend on in the build. We need to allow builds to operate correctly on base-64, with the goal of moving to base-64 as the only supported platform for builds."

It would have been good if that bug could have better described what packages we hope to eventually rely on (better rust support in mdb/DTrace maybe?) but my understanding is that this bug (OS-7775) was the fix that was going to get us there.

While fix doesn't actually require a flag day (I was able to build these changes on our current 15.4 jenkins agents), I suspect that in order to do the work hinted at above, we need to have build infrastructure in place first.

We don't want to tell everyone to transition unless we're going to do all the jenkins/build infrastructure change. Also, if this is going to change everything, then we need to make sure that we update the ugprade docs, go through and test that and try to make this relatively painless. I'd encourage that we split the actual upgrade off, get this fixed. Then get the autobuilding of the bootstrap working in base-64, then get jenkins ready for that, and then ask everyone to make that transition, rather than living in a world where it may work, but someone may break you at any time.

I actually was intending on doing the jenkins infrastructure change at the same time as integrating this change (but read on!)

I didn't know about https://github.com/joyent/smartos-live/blob/master/docs/dev-upgrade.md though, so thanks for pointing at that, I agree it needs to be updated.

[my habit is to use throwaway devzones, but totally understand that others have different practices and agree that we need to cater for those]

I'm not quite sure on the reasoning for staggering the switch though?  That is, if I'm understanding you correctly, you're saying we should push this change without the README.md modifications, and continue to build on older devzones, then work on testing the upgrade experience and push a separate change with that advice later, and only at that point should we switch our jenkins agents to base-64 images.

Are you suggesting this approach to let more adventurous developers build on base-64 zones more quickly, rather than have to wait for the official upgrade documentation?
why are we passing this in here, instead of letting illumos-extra's Makefiles pick up the build.env contents?

Just a sense of wanting to be explicit in what we're passing, so that our intent gets shown in build logs.

Generally, I'm a bit uneasy about having builds rely on magic environment variables. That said, I'm happy to remove this if you prefer?
I don't get what's magic about build.env - we populate it, and we already rely on its contents in illumos-extra. It's not taken from the environment. Please remove this bit.
Ok, I've made that change in patch set 2.
How does this work in a new zone where there is no gcc installed? In other words, our installing of build-essential by running this script is what will cause a compiler to exist.

Ah! Good point - I'd only tested a fresh base-64 zone, not an older multiarch zone. This code needs to switch to parsing the output of 'pkgin show-deps build-essential' I think, but I'll test that theory to make sure.

Can we just always install gcc4?
If/when gcc4 goes away from illumos-extra, we can remove it again.

Yes we can, and that simplifies things here in that we can then always set HOST_GCC4_PREFIX to /opt/local/gcc49/bin.
I'll do that.
can be dropped again
oh, thanks yep.
